intro: Vasconcellea peltata, commonly known as the peltate waxplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Mexico, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in a waxy coating, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage. Vasconcellea peltata is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid environments with well-drained soil.
